A secret RSA message was encrypted with distinct blum integers as moduli. Can you exploit their properties to recover the plaintext from 3100490012406130160380200661344964735038800964517412201268347229455269573527814079289460489026502485248130639366417529610472793227946799376869301162766927?

The flag format is flag{...}
n=6049368416311056539681351085792660768106211548768359006524869826641937830926714644555848749413789639768435223985439404499076996889811711182798443183710773, e=2911226167489252659846167843590365511084446195457532099940816733451365900239859553913541174988398087049987888064291499420603063786723025065493112601900601
The lower 104 bits of p are: 62414725303865070811249145166002746199


---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{b5l02zeg}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 3100490012406130160380200661344964735038800964517412201268347229455269573527814079289460489026502485248130639366417529610472793227946799376869301162766927
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=6049368416311056539681351085792660768106211548768359006524869826641937830926714644555848749413789639768435223985439404499076996889811711182798443183710773, e=2911226167489252659846167843590365511084446195457532099940816733451365900239859553913541174988398087049987888064291499420603063786723025065493112601900601
The lower 104 bits of p are: 62414725303865070811249145166002746199
